fields.summary: Semijoin and analyze: Implement a Long -> Hash64 vector fast-path

status.name: Closed

fields.description: See comments on HIVE-18866; this has significant perf overhead after the even bigger overhead from hashing is removed.  !Screen Shot 2018-05-16 at 15.29.12 .png!
fields.summary: HLL merges tempList on every add

comments.body: HLL p value is also changing to 10 in HIVE-18079. With that the encoding switch threshold is only 153 but temp list's default size is 1024. So there is no point maintaining temp list. I will probably remove temp list as it will not help and can cut on additional branches.

Int2ByteSortedMap is in fastutil. This dependency is 18MB jar. I am not sure if it be worth it to bring such a big dependency as this jar also has to be bundled with hive-exec. We discussed this during the initial HLL implementation that this 3rd party dependency is big and replaced Int2ByteSortedMap with java TreeMap. If performance becomes a bigger concern we can consider bringing the jar, I think for now we can stick on to TreeMap and add just the optimizations.
[~sershe] can you please review?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12923877 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

So the temp list is useless? I wonder if it would still provide perf improvement, esp. without merging it on getSize. How precise does getSize have to be.

If it's not useful, LGTM +1

Actually, let me put up another patch that retains temp list. getSize() does not have to be precise. We can return sparseMap.size() + tempListIdx which is sufficient enough. I tried this yesterday and for some reason few tests failed. I figured out what went wrong.
[~sershe] can you look at .2 patch?

"if (sparseMap.containsKey" block is gone; by design?
+1
Yes. It used to be containsKey -> get -> put.. now its get -> put.. one less lookup and a branch..
